alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Liberty; Wakulla (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 02 at 2:41PM EST until December 02 at 5:45PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Franklin County in Big Bend Florida... Southeastern Liberty County in Big Bend Florida... Wakulla County in Big Bend Florida... * Until 545 PM EST. * At 241 PM EST, Wakulla County Dispatch has reported several flooded roadways across the County. Between 5 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Woodville, Crawfordville, St. Marks, Wakulla, Sopchoppy, Buckhorn, Arran, Tully, Medart, Panacea, Curtis Mill, Spring Creek, Sanborn, Panacea-Wakulla Airport, Mcintyre, Hilliardville, Shadeville, Bethel, Shell Point and Smith Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
